original:
Nicola Horlick, the former chief executive of Morgan Grenfell Asset Management, has reportedly admitted to holding discussions with ABN AMRO before her suspension from Morgan Grenfell in 1997.
Horlick, who was known at the time as one of the most prominent women in finance, left Morgan Grenfell following allegations that she had encouraged colleagues to invest in a film scheme that was later found
sampled:
Nicola Horlick, the former chief executive in Morgan Grenfell Asset Coordination, has reportedly admitted to holding discussions with ABN AMRO before her suspension from Morgan Grenfell in 1997.
Horlick, who was known at the time as one with the most prominent women in finance, left Morgan Grenfell following allegations that she had encouraged colleagues to invest in a film scheme that was later found
